message.content:
I'll calculate the requested financial ratios step by step based on the provided financial statements.

### Current Ratio
Current Ratio = Total Current Assets / Total Current Liabilities
Current Ratio = $8,810,936.45 / $2,491,297.55 = 3.54

### Gross Profit Margin
Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Gross Profit Margin = ($1,535,951.24 / $7,825,951.24) × 100% = 19.63%

### Debt to Asset Ratio
Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets
Debt to Asset Ratio = $2,491,297.55 / $14,089,860.66 = 0.18

### Net Profit Margin
Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Net Profit Margin = (-$1,401,436.89 / $7,825,951.24) × 100% = -17.91%

### Cash to Current Debt Ratio
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = (Cash on Hand + Bank Deposits) / Total Current Liabilities
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = ($1,753,673.43 + $1,522,888.62) / $2,491,297.55 = $3,276,562.05 / $2,491,297.55 = 1.32

### Free Cash Flow (FCF)
FCF = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities - Capital Expenditures
FCF = -$4,398,760.38 - $324,677.57 = -$4,723,437.95

### Return on Assets (ROA)
ROA = (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100%
ROA = (-$1,401,436.89 / $14,089,860.66) × 100% = -9.95%

```json
{"solution": {'Current Ratio': '3.54', 'Gross Profit Margin': '19.63%', 'Debt to Asset Ratio': '0.18', 'Net Profit Margin': '-17.91%', 'Cash to Current Debt Ratio': '1.32', 'Free Cash Flow (FCF)': '-4723437.95', 'Return on Assets (ROA)': '-9.95%'} }
```
